block.p: Jane Wasey Reilly, the daughter of Lukie Chapman Reilly of Chatham, Mass., and William F. Reilly of New York, was married yesterday to Gerald Kenneth Mount Jr., the son of Myrl Kluge of Charleston, S.C., and Mr. Mount Sr. of Orangeburg, S.C. The Rev. Philippa A. Turner performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest in New York.

The bride, 33, is keeping her name. She is the director of Internet content development for the magazine and Internet division of Primedia, the media company in New York, of which her father is a former chairman and chief executive. The bride graduated from Kenyon College. Her mother is a freelance writer in Chatham.

Jane Wasey Reilly, the daughter of Lukie Chapman Reilly of Chatham, Mass., and William F. Reilly of New York, was married yesterday to Gerald Kenneth Mount Jr., the son of Myrl Kluge of Charleston, S.C., and Mr. Mount Sr. of Orangeburg, S.C. The Rev. Philippa A. Turner performed the ceremony at the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest in New York.

The bride, 33, is keeping her name. She is the director of Internet content development for the magazine and Internet division of Primedia, the media company in New York, of which her father is a former chairman and chief executive. The bride graduated from Kenyon College. Her mother is a freelance writer in Chatham.

The bridegroom, 39, is the Northeast regional director in New York for Aprisma Management Technologies, a software development company. He graduated from the University of South Carolina. His mother retired from the Defense Department as a special agent in Charleston for the Defense Investigative Service. His father owns Mount Kennels in Orangeburg, where he breeds and trains Labrador retrievers.
